column4: hi there, I've just scanned an image using xsane and it saved the fiel as a .pnm ... what do I use to view/edit it now?
also, install netpbm for conversion tools.
gimp doesn't like it, not tried the others
gimp opens pnm files usually. Maybe it's faulty.
done 5 or 6 different files, it won't open any of them... could it be that xsane didn't save the files right?
it's possible, but too early to conclude, since you haven't tried any viewers yet.
you could also try sane from within gimp. (File - Acquire I think)
well, the pnms kill eog... trying gqview
that last one would only work if I still had the source... :( gqview doesn't work either.
try pnmfile from netpbm for info about your file
output from "pnmfile Desktop/tartan\ photos+/tartanscan0001.pnm" = Desktop/tartan photos+/tartanscan0001.pnm:      PPM raw, 849 by 1159  maxval 65535
that's good. Try pnmtopng tartanscan0001.pnm >tartanscan0001.png and open the png
sweet! is it the same syntax if I want to use pnmtotiff? ie pnmtotiff tartanscan0001.pnm >tartanscan0001.tiff
hmm.... it's got a colourmap problem now as well - there's too many colours apparently, but that's ok, the tiff seems fine.
